channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A theory why the internet is going down the toilet
item.description: A new book diagnoses a sickness affecting some of America's biggest companies.

item.title: Some ant architects design a colony to cut the risk of disease. Humans, take note!
item.description: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.

item.title: Blue New Jersey is expecting a very close race for governor this November
item.description: President Trump and former President Obama have endorsed the two candidates locked in a tight race for New Jersey governor, Republican Jack Ciattarell...

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress
item.description: Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stal...

item.title: Shutdown to impact federal workers' pay. And, tensions grow between U.S. and Colombia
item.description: Some federal employees may not receive a paycheck this Friday due to the government shutdown. And, tensions between Colombia and the U.S. continue to ...

item.title: US chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies aged 29
item.description: The young prodigy's "unexpected passing" was announced by his family on Monday.

item.title: French ex-president Sarkozy begins jail sentence for campaign finance conspiracy
item.description: Nicolas Sarkozy, president from 2007-2012, has appealed against his jail term at La Sant√© prison.

item.title: Weather balloon may have hit and cracked United flight's windshield
item.description: A United Airlines flight diverted to Salt Lake City after the pilots discovered a crack in one of the layers of the windshield. A weather balloon hitt...

item.title: Belize agrees to host migrants seeking asylum in US
item.description: Belize's prime minister says the deal will mean that migrants can apply for asylum in the country.

item.title: Woman charged after 1.5m euros of gold stolen from Paris museum
item.description: Prosecutors say the woman was arrested in Barcelona with around a kilo of melted down gold.

item.title: Lime growers' leader killed after complaining about cartel extortion
item.description: The body of Bernardo Bravo, president of the Apatzingan Valley Citrus Producers Association, was found in his vehicle, officials said.

item.title: Pardoned Capitol rioter charged with threatening to kill Hakeem Jeffries
item.description: A pardoned Capitol rioter was arrested last weekend for allegedly threatening to kill the top House Democrat.

item.title: Slovak PM Fico's attacker sentenced to 21 years in prison
item.description: Juraj Cintula - who fired five shots at close range at the prime minister - was found guilty of terrorism charges.

item.title: 9/16: CBS Morning News
item.description: Charlie Kirk murder suspect appears to have confessed to killing on Discord; Federal Reserve expected to cut interest rates.

item.title: Ex-French leader Sarkozy declares himself "an innocent man" as he's jailed
item.description: Former president Nicolas Sarkozy's lawyers say, as he shows up to a Paris prison to serve a five-year sentence, that they've already appealed for his ...

item.title: ICE would need more money to expand use of bodycams in Chicago crackdown, official says
US appeals court says Trump can take command of Oregon troops though deployment blocked for now
item.description: A U.S. appeals court has ruled that President Donald Trump can take command of 200 Oregon National Guard troops.

item.title: What to know about the recovery efforts in Alaska following ex-Typhoon Halong
